question:
Tibetan government in exile celebrated its 59th Democracy Day. In that context, consider the following:
  1. This is celebrated as the anniversary of Dalai Lama’s detailed program of democratic practice by the exiled people Tibet.
  2. Kashag is the legislative body of the Central Tibetan Administration.
Which of the above statements is/are correct?
explanation: Statement 1 is correct: In September 2, 1960, the 14th Dalai Lama, in Bodh Gaya, had brought in the details of the democratic governance of the exiled people of Tibet. He urged the setting up of an elected body that has three elected representatives – each representing the provinces of Tibet and one each from four religious schools of Tibetan Buddhism     Statement 2 is incorrect: Kashag is the executive body of the Central Tibetan Administration. Parliament- in-exile is the highest legislative body and Tibetan Supreme Justice Commission is the judicial organ of the CTA.
